Package nl.naturalis.geneious.bold

Class BoldNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.geneious.bold.BoldNormalizer
  • class BoldNormalizer
extends Object
    Normalizes BOLD source files so that they can be processed just like sample sheets and CRS files. BOLD files contain repeating triplets of marker-related columns. After normalization each triplet is in a separate row, with the non-repeating columns in the original file now repeating row-wise. In the original file the marker itself does not have its own column. Instead it must be inferred (excised) from the column headers. In the normalized version the marker does have its own column.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

      Returns the number of rows in the spreadsheet before normalization and excluding header rows;

      Returns the markers found in the header of the spreadsheet.
      (package private) List<String[]> getRows()
      Returns the rows for an arbitrary marker or, if the spreadsheet did not contain any markers, a new list of rows with only specimen information.
      (package private) Map<String,​List<String[]>> getRowsPerMarker()

    • Method Detail

      • countRows

        int countRows()
        Returns the number of rows in the spreadsheet before normalization and excluding header rows;
        Returns:

      • getMarkers

        List<String> getMarkers()
        Returns the markers found in the header of the spreadsheet. Note however that if the "Seq. Length" column of a triplet of marker columns is completely empty (i.e. none of the rows have a value in the "Seq. Length" column), that marker is considered absent and will not be included in the returned list.
        Returns:

      • getRowsPerMarker

        Map<String,​List<String[]>> getRowsPerMarker()
        Returns a per-marker list of rows. The map might be empty if the BOLD spreadsheet did not contain any marker-related columns or (more hypothetically) it did, but the "Seq. Length" column was blank for all rows. The keys in the returned map are the markers, in the same order as they were found in the spreadsheet.
        Returns:

      • getRows

        List<String[]> getRows()
        Returns the rows for an arbitrary marker or, if the spreadsheet did not contain any markers, a new list of rows with only specimen information.
        Returns:
